intro: Byrsella elephanticeps, commonly known as the elephant's head plant, is a unique succulent native to South Africa. It features a thick, fleshy stem that resembles an elephant's head, giving it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers during the summer months. Its leaves are thick and waxy, adapted to store water in arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
